abstracts.cdata!:
This program document the second of a
            programmatic series of two Economic Governance Reform Grants
            (EGRGs) for the Republic of Guinea-Bissau. The operation
            supports the continuation of the selective reform agenda
            initiated by the Government in 2009 with the support of the
            EGRG I. The reform momentum under both the Public Financial
            Management (PFM) and the Private Sector Development (PSD)
            planks has been sustained. The PFM plank aims at
            consolidating the setting up of a modern legal framework for
            public financial management that is consistent with the West
            African Economic and Monetary Union (WAEMU) standards, and
            promoting compliance with this legal framework through
            systems, controls and operational reforms. The PSD plank
            aims at consolidating the setting up of a modern legal
            framework for private investment and improving the
            administrative environment for business. Both PFM and PSD
            reforms are needed jointly to restore confidence in public
            policy and institutions and support macroeconomic stability.
            The design of the reform program builds on analytical work
            in these two areas and leverages activities supported by
            other International Development Association (IDA)-funded
            instruments, including Low Income Countries Under Stress
            (LICUS) and State and Peace-building Fund (SPF) grant funded
            operations and the IDA Private Sector Rehabilitation and
            Development Project (PSRDP). The operation also complements
            support provided by the African Development Bank (AfDB),
            Portugal, the European Union (EU), the International
            Monetary Fund (IMF), and other donors in related critical areas.
